zc.thread
Interface Lock

All Known Implementing Classes:
Mutex, FIFOSemaphore, Semaphore
public interface Lock

Main interface for Semaphore, Mutex and CondVar.

Most Locks are intended to be used primarily (although not exclusively) in before/after constructions such as: 

 class X {
  public void doSomething(Lock lock) {
      try {
          // acquire the Lock before the body
          lock.acquire();

          try {
              // ... method body
          }
          finally {
              // release the Lock after the body
              lock.release()
          }
      }
      catch(InterruptedException ex) {
          // ... evasive action
      }
  }
  public void doSomethingElse(Lock lock) {
      try {
          // try the condition for 10 ms
          if(lock.attempt(10)) {
              try {
                  // ... method body
              }
              finally {
                  lock.release()
              }
          }
      }
      catch (InterruptedException ex) {
          // ... evasive action
      }
  }
 }

Method Summary
 void acquire()
          Wait (possibly forever) until successful passage.
 boolean attempt(long msecs)
          Wait at most msecs or until successful passage in an attempt to acquire the Lock.
 void release()
          Release a Lock, potentially enable another blocked Thread to pass.
 

Method Detail

acquire

public void acquire()
             throws java.lang.InterruptedException
Wait (possibly forever) until successful passage.
Throws:
java.lang.InterruptedException - if the calling thread is interrupted while waiting. On failure, you can be sure that this Lock has not been acquired, and that no corresponding release should be performed. Conversely, a normal return guarantees that the acquire was successful.

attempt

public boolean attempt(long msecs)
                throws java.lang.InterruptedException
Wait at most msecs or until successful passage in an attempt to acquire the Lock.
Parameters:
msecs - the number of milliseconds to wait for the Lock before giving up.
Returns:
true if the Lock has been acquired within the given time.
Throws:
java.lang.InterruptedException - if the calling thread is interrupted while waiting. On failure, you can be sure that this Lock has not been acquired, and that no corresponding release should be performed. Conversely, a normal return guarantees that the acquire was successful.

release

public void release()
Release a Lock, potentially enable another blocked Thread to pass.

release do not raise exceptions, thus it can be used in `finally' clauses without requiring extra try/catch blocks.
